Normal people’s night routine: Skincare, meditation, 8 hours of sleep.

Me: Staring at the ceiling while thinking about that HR who saw my profile, liked my work experience, texted me on LinkedIn and asked for my Resume and then rejected me in 1 min.

Bro, my resume was my LinkedIn.

Bro, what did you see in it?

⚡️'You won’t believe what happened when I taught a chaiwala SQL.'
I gave him a free YouTube playlist.
He finished it in 15 days.

Then built a dashboard for his tea stall.
Now he tracks peak hours, top-selling items, and even tips.

He doesn’t have a degree.
He has discipline.

Degrees help.
But curiosity? It changes lives.

Never underestimate the power of free resources - and the will to learn.
Never underestimate me, I can write good fictional stories.

Thanks!

HR: 'We want someone who can handle pressure.'
Bhai, job chahiye ya Squid Game jeetna hai?

JD padh ke toh lag raha hai ki:

Coding bhi karo

Designing bhi karo

Marketing bhi sambhalo

Sales bhi le aao

Aur haan, chai bhi tumhi bana lena

Salary?
'We offer industry standards.'
Industry kaunse planet ki bhai?

Experience required: 2 years
Budget: 15k/month
Location: Bangalore (WFH not allowed, but chai peena allowed)

Also...
'We’re like a family'

Nahi bhai, kaafi toxic joint family lag rahe ho.

Dear companies,
Candidates want growth.
Not gaslighting.
Jobs, not jugaad.
Salaries, not samjhauta.

Boss - Why aren't you picking up my call?

Me - I am at a funeral.

Boss - What happened? Who died?

Me - My interest in working in your company.

Dear Job,

It’s not me. 
It’s definitely you.

When we first met, you promised me growth, learning, and free coffee.

Instead, you gave me:

- Emotional damage 
- 937 Zoom calls that could’ve been emails 
- Performance reviews based on vibes 
- And a salary that ghosted inflation like it’s an ex

You said, 'We’re a team.' 
But every time something went wrong, suddenly it was just me.

You said, 'Take ownership.' 
So I took ownership of my sanity… and I’m leaving.

You’ll find someone new. 
Probably a fresher who calls you 'Sir' and says yes to weekend work.

I wish you the best. 
But please don’t text me at 11 PM with 'Just one quick thing.' 
We’re done.

Warm regards, 
(Colder soul) 
Your Former Employee of the Month (forced)

A story of my friend 24 M.

My friend thought he found love.
But what he really found… was someone who wanted a referral. 💀

A girl messaged him on LinkedIn:
'Heyy, I’ve seen your posts. You’re sooo cool 😍 also… are there any openings at your company?'

That 'heyy' with two y’s? Fatal.
That 😍 emoji? Career-ending.

My man was already planning date destinations. 😭
She started calling him late at night:
'Can you help me prepare for the interview? I get nervous easily… you’re the only one who makes me feel calm 🥺'

He started learning SQL and how to impress future in-laws. 😭

She sent selfies like:
'How do I look for the Zoom interview? 👗💄'

Bro said, 'Perfect. You look perfect. For the job. And… for life.'
(He even ironed his shirt. For her interview.) 🤡

He went full Ranbir Kapoor for her.
Wrote a long email to HR:
‘She’s different. She’s passionate. She’s everything this company needs.’

HR reluctantly agreed.

She got the job.
He got played.

And 3 days after she joined, she said:
'I’m really focusing on myself right now… also I’ve started seeing someone else. Hope we can still be good friends :)'

GOOD FRIENDS??
Ma’am you just used his heart like a step-ladder to climb the corporate stairs. 😭

Now she shares posts on LinkedIn:
‘Manifestation works. Believe in yourself ❤️’

Meanwhile, my friend’s only manifestation is HR rejecting her appraisal next year. 😤

Lessons learned:
'You’re sooo helpful' = 'Thanks, servant.'

If someone sends you a selfie before the interview, run.

Never fall for a candidate who uses both emojis and tears as strategy.
LinkedIn is for referrals, not romance.

And HR doesn’t approve emotional reimbursements.

'Stay positive.'
'Good things take time.'
'Everything happens for a reason.'

Yes.

The reason is - companies want 25-year-olds with 30 years of experience and no salary expectations.

I’ve applied to jobs at 3 AM.
Wrote 500 custom cover letters.
Got ghosted more than on dating apps.
Even ChatGPT is tired of writing resumes for me.

But people on LinkedIn?
They’ll say:
'Just keep manifesting.'
'Rejection is redirection.'

No, Priya.
Rejection is depression when you haven’t paid rent in 2 months.

So if you’re out there job hunting—
Tired, angry, confused, and still holding on?

You’re not alone.

You’re not lazy.
You’re just stuck in a broken system romanticized with Canva quotes.

You will never be criticized by someone doing more than you.
Only by someone doing less.

Criticism is a defense mechanism.
They’re not attacking you -
They’re attacking their own insecurities.

It’s easier to tear you down than face their own lack of effort.
But guess what?

You’ll keep growing, and they’ll stay stuck.
The only thing they’ll ever beat you at is talking.

No IIT. No IIM. No godfather. 
Still made it.
Because hunger > background.

A good manager doesn’t just manage your work. 
They protect your sanity.

They guide you, support you, and get the best out of you - without making you feel like trash.

But a bad manager? 
They make you question your worth every single day.

According to a *Gallup study*, 70% of the variance in team engagement is directly linked to the *manager*. 

Another survey shows *65% of employees would take a new boss over a pay raise*.

People don’t leave jobs. 
They leave toxic managers. 
And no amount of free coffee or flexible hours can fix that.

If you're a manager, ask yourself honestly: 
*Would *you* want to report to you?*
